frontmatter.description: Input and output in C++ are done with cin >> and cout << respectively. Before using them, be sure to include the iostream library header.
frontmatter.title: Input and Output

frontmatter.description: C++ and other programming languages use if statements to control the flow of the program. Syntax: if (condition) { //code }
frontmatter.title: If Statements

frontmatter.description: Variables in C++ are declared with "DataType varName = value;". The name of the variable can be anyting you want while putting the value during declaration is optional.
frontmatter.title: Variables and Data Types

frontmatter.description: First time learning programming? Start here! A C++ tutorial for beginners, learn how to write "Hello World" and how it works in C++
frontmatter.title: Hello World!
